title: UnERFing auxin-mediated degradation in the emerging lateral root
content: The development of lateral roots (LRs) was essential for the successful colonization of land by vascular plants. These roots play an important role in acquiring water and nutrients, facilitating below-ground exploration, and aiding in anchoring both young and established plants to their growth substrate. LR formation is so important, in fact, that it is a defining feature of all extant euphyllophytes (Hetherington et al. 2020). Understanding root plasticity and the regulatory mechanisms controlling the seemingly spontaneous formation of these post-embryonic organs therefore goes hand-in-hand with our understanding of plant adaptation and evolution.
